newsitem.title: USA: Exporters sell wheat to Egypt, barley to unknown.
newsitem.headline: Exporters sell wheat to Egypt, barley to unknown.

text.p: U.S. exporters reported the sale of 200,000 tonnes of soft red winter wheat to Egypt and 110,000 tonnes of barley to unknown purchasers, both for 1997/98 delivery, U.S. Agriculture Department said Friday.
Marketing year for wheat and barley begins June 1.
Exporters are required to promptly report sales of 100,000 tonnes or more of a commodity. It sometimes takes a couple of days for the identity of a buyer to become known.
